updateMenu.deleted: The following effects will be DELETED from a previous version of 'D&D5e Animations'.
updateMenu.added: The following effects are going to be added to your Autorecognition settings.
updateMenu.custom: The following effects won't be added due to them already existing from an unknown source.
updateMenu.customHint: If you want the 'D&D5e Animations' version, delete them from your Autorecognition Menu.
updateMenu.updated: The following effects will be updated from a previous version of 'D&D5e Animations' (or from Automated Animations default menu).
updateMenu.blacklisted: The following effects have been blacklisted and will be removed from your Autorecognition Menu.
updateMenu.warning: Make sure to backup your autorecognition menu! THIS PROCESS IS IRREVERSIBLE.
updateMenu.debugCustom: The following effects do not exist in D&D5e Animations, they are completely new and will remain in your Autorecognition Menu.

notifications.update: D&D5e Animations v{version} loaded. Please check if you don't have new animations to be added to your autorecognition menu!
notifications.unevenGrid: Your scene's grid is uneven ({grid}px). This will likely cause your target location to be offset!
notifications.gridless: Crosshairs are recommended to be used only on a grid-based scene. Gridless scenes can cause issues.
notifications.wrongVersion: You are missing {modules} for D&D5e Animations to fully function! Please update the modules listed!
notifications.noDependencies: You are missing {modules} for D&D5e Animations to fully function! Please enable the modules listed!
notifications.noJB2A: You need a JB2A module enabled to use with D&D5e Animations module!
notifications.noDummy: Missing dummy actors for summoning macros.
notifications.tooManyArgs: Too many arguments for this macro! The following arguments are incompatible: {issues}
notifications.noPrem: You are missing the premium version of JB2A assets to use this animation!
notifications.metaData: This animation WILL be replaced when updated. If you don't want it to be, best way is to temporarily change it's animation or variant to something else, or enabling Debug mode in the settings and pressing the Metadata button again.

autoUpdate.name: Open Update Menu on Module Update
autoUpdate.hint: Automatically open the Autorecognition Update Menu when the module is updated.

debug.name: Debug Mode
debug.hint: Enables console logs of what D&D5e Animations module is doing.
